abstract: HSBC is considering replacing the BlackBerry with Apple’s new iPhone 3G as the mobile device of its global workforce, the banking giant’s Australia and New Zealand chief information officer told ZDNet Australia.
snippet: HSBC is considering replacing the BlackBerry with Apple’s new iPhone 3G as the mobile device of its global workforce, the banking giant’s Australia and New Zealand chief information officer told ZDNet Australia.
lead_paragraph: Now that Apple‘s revamped iPhone has become a certifiable blockbuster, will it prompt the corporate market to consider using it instead of the old standby that is the BlackBerry?

headline.main: For HSBC, the New iPhone May Prove Alluring
